body_html:
@sherrym for example, if we have reduceByKey operation then we can reduce the number of instance on every truth-prediction pair so that we can implement the confusion matrix in tensorflow api.
#1606
what's more, there's many preprocessing procedure before training a model, if the data is big then we need to use spark or whatever to do the preprocessing distributedly. If tensorflow support map/reduce api, then we can just directly do it in tensorflow and don't need other toolchains.
Actually, the tensorflow graph architecture is quite similar to spark's DAG architecture, and I believe we could do similar things as what spark could do.

body:
@sherrym for example, if we have reduceByKey operation then we can reduce the number of instance on every truth-prediction pair so that we can implement the confusion matrix in tensorflow api.
#1606 
what's more, there's many preprocessing procedure before training a model, if the data is big then we need to use spark or whatever to do the preprocessing distributedly. If tensorflow support map/reduce api, then we can just directly do it in tensorflow and don't need other toolchains.
Actually, the tensorflow graph architecture is quite similar to spark's DAG architecture, and I believe we could do similar things as what spark could do.
